name: Word Search (Phoenix Publishing)
overview: This is a brainteaser you have probably come across in puzzle magazines, but that doesn't make it any easier. The words which are hidden in the screen spaghetti are all four letter — related to food or drink. When you have found one of the twenty words on the screen, key it in and press RETURN. If your guess is correct your word will be ticked. After a few seconds the word w ill be erased and your next word must be entered. The words you have found to date will be coloured in red on the screen, which should make it easier for you to spot the others. To change the screen key in NEXT and press RETURN. The computer takes a short time to generate the letters before they are displayed, and during this time the screen is blank. A game created by Geneviève Ludinski from the book "Brainteasers for the Commodore 64", released in 1983.
